Description: Shoulder sherd of Clazomenian black-figured pottery slim neck-amphora; exterior: painted decoration consisting of seven rows of scales with added white dot in centre of each scale and single added red dot on top of white dot.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by University College London. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GH.114) (phase 3)
Cook 1952 / A List of Clazomenian Pottery (p. 129, no. 22) (possibly)
